Articles.Content:
Sweet, thanks! NASA TV? URL?

Here

, here http://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/nasatv/index.html or here http://www.ustream.tv/nasahdtv

Here is simulation of what we can expect in next hours/days:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

However I don't know how accurate is this.

I read the probe only uses 22 watts in full swing and that the RTG produces about 10 times that. It seems power requirements are not the reason communication is cut off.

...

New Horizons was build a light weight as possible. It has a fixed radio dish and is not capable to point the radio dish at earth and keep the camera's pointing towards Pluto at the same time. Capturing data outweighs the need to transmit.

Now that closed approach has passed it can rotate back facing earth and transmit its findings.
I think they're going to have 30 minutes of teasing us with reaction shots now.
This. GIF.

It's been front page http://www.nasa.gov/ all week. Minimal digging there will find it.

Alternately this. LAG BEGONE!

http://www.space.com/17933-nasa-television-webcasts-live-space-tv.html

My bad, I went straight to NASA TV and it appeared as if I missed it.
On a side note: Why do you and RIC have no rep?

(or How RIC got his rep back daddyac. Give a dog a bone?)

You can disable the viewing of rep in your profile if you want.

I've read an article in Polish press about NH. It bore ridiculously bombastic title "Last secret of Solar System solved" - or something like that. What a pile of steaming bovine scat I bet new photos will show dozens of features, scientific community will be poking and prodding for decades to come. And the rest of the system? There are unexplored areas on Earth to this day - and in space? Eight planets, dozen or so dwarf planets, scores of moons, countless asteroids and comets... There is plenty of work for a hundred generations of scientists and discoverers - we just need to finally get our behinds in gear and go there.

This. GIF.

http://media.giphy.com/media/3oEduHREX59zIgzp84/giphy.gif

lol

Well, you have to admit, that would definitely be a much more interesting result than expected.

I've read an article in Polish press about NH. It bore ridiculously bombastic title "Last secret of Solar System solved" - or something like that. What a pile of steaming bovine scat
Wow, I thought FOX/CNN was a purely U.S. problem...

I've read an article in Polish press about NH. It bore ridiculously bombastic title "Last secret of Solar System solved" - or something like that. What a pile of steaming bovine scat I bet new photos will show dozens of features, scientific community will be poking and prodding for decades to come. And the rest of the system? There are unexplored areas on Earth to this day - and in space? Eight planets, dozen or so dwarf planets, scores of moons, countless asteroids and comets... There is plenty of work for a hundred generations of scientists and discoverers - we just need to finally get our behinds in gear and go there.

Clickbait journalism is clickbait journalism.

We haven't even gone fishing on Europa yet.

This. GIF.

http://media.giphy.com/media/3oEduHREX59zIgzp84/giphy.gif

That's no moon...

I read the probe only uses 22 watts in full swing and that the RTG produces about 10 times that. It seems power requirements are not the reason communication is cut off.

224 watts during launch, now probably less than 200.

That's no moon...

I still hope NH will find a Mass Relay frozen inside Charon Or...maybe better not *gulp*
I absolutely adore that Pluto looks like it has two little arms that hold a big heart in their hands.
In 15 minutes we should be seeing the yellow photos in this image.

I absolutely adore that Pluto looks like it has two little arms that hold a big heart in their hands.

That's no heart...
That's no heart...

New pic in!

- - - Updated - - -

Also, I like this one even more.

New pic in!

http://imgick.silive.com/home/silive-media/width620/img/latest_news/photo/pluto-death-starjpg-0912af5ea77e42c3.jpg

Other end of the barycenter, Pluto is Alderaan.

Other end of the barycenter, Pluto is Alderaan.

No way man, that's what they want you to think. George Lucas is a plant.
It won't be long now...

In 15 minutes we should be seeing the yellow photos in this image.

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CJ-cvZVVEAE8iKN.png:large

Are those the only high-res shots we'll get, or will we eventually get the entire hemisphere?
I cant wait!

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/CJ42wXJWcAEMt60.jpg:large

Yep! It can not be unseen

In 15 minutes we should be seeing the yellow photos in this image.

The top-right yellow one is just going to be one big beige square?
